alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 8:57PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GILA, COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM MST... At 857 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fossil Creek Day Use Area, or 18 miles northwest of Payson, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... The Toilet Bowl, Fossil Creek Day Use Area, Childs Power Plant, Fossil Creek Waterfall, and Strawberry. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 231 and 241, and near mile marker 249. State Route 87 between mile markers 270 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
